benchmark_details.name: MultiADE: A Multi-domain benchmark for Adverse Drug Event extraction
benchmark_details.overview: MultiADE is a multi-domain benchmark for adverse drug event extraction comprising several existing datasets sampled from different text types along with a newly created dataset CADECv2.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To build a single model for adverse drug event extraction that works well on various text types.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The generalisation of the trained models is far from perfect, making it infeasible to deploy models across different text types.

data.source: Existing datasets from previous adverse drug event extraction works and a newly created dataset CADECv2.
data.size: 3,548 online posts, 1,250 CADEC posts, 505 n2c2 summaries, 1,089 MADE records, 4,827 PHEE articles, and 3,147 PsyTAR posts.
data.annotation: Annotated by human annotators following detailed annotation guidelines.

methodology.calculation: F1 scores calculated based on model predictions and ground truth annotations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better model performance on the task.
methodology.validation: Tested against multiple datasets and compared using cross-domain generalization.
